intro: Androsaemum cambessedesii, commonly known as the Socotra jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra in the Arabian Sea. It is characterized by its aromatic, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a strong jasmine-like scent. The plant has narrow, strap-like leaves and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Androsaemum cambessedesii is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its endemic environment.
